data.name: Honey Do Golden Ale
data.description: Honey Do Golden Ale is a lighter bodied golden ale with a slight sweet honey flavor.  We blended honey malt and local beekeeper honey to give this beer a subtle honey taste with a distinctive Saaz hop spiciness.  This warm weather ale offers easy drinkability for those new to craft beers but still provides plenty of flavor for craft beer lovers.

breweries.name: Salish Sea Brewing
breweries.description:
Salish Sea Brewing Co. is focused on providing the best the region has to offer in fine hand-crafted ales and lagers.

Jeff and Erika are regular people with real dreams. Erika and Jeff were friends in early college years who found each other later, dated, got married, started a family, then asked each other, “What do you really want to do in life…(when you grow up)?”  They liked beer, liked making beer, liked having a good time, and liked sharing their likes with others.

Their first homebrew settings were humble: Jeff’s nose sticking deep into a carboy of fermenting beer in a friend's small apartment.

They evolved from the stove top with extract batches, to setting up a small, all-grain batch brewery (8 gallon kettles - Thanksgiving turkey frying pots -  on propane burners with converted coolers for mash tuns) on the back porch,  to bigger and bigger goals.  From a 5 gallon pot on the stove (with a batch of extract syrup), to a 10 gallon converted cooler (with cracked grain), and kegs turned to kettles, to working on a 15 barrel brewery creating batches that go state to state, national, international...  They made batches at home for themselves, their friends, for weddings, parties, etc..  and realized this is what they wanted to do for a job.   Jeff apprenticed with a professional brewer (local celebrity Skip Madsen of Pike, Boundary Bay, American, etc…) and learned the pro angle of the trade.   They have seen the evolution, gone through it, appreciate it, and are happy to be where they are today.

Salish Sea Brewing Co. is a 10 bbl (310 gallon per batch) establishment.  We hope to brew twice a week, offering a variety of ales and the occasional lager and pilsner. 

Jeff and Erika have a  6-year-old little girl and a 2-year-old son.  They are family oriented and hope for the brewery to be family approachable.   Families are welcome, but this is a brewery with a tasting room, not a playground (we do not cater to children).  Please respect our space and the space of others.  Minors must be accompanied by an adult. 

Our roots are solid, our goals are lofty, but our dreams, aspirations, and hopes are high.  We want to create a place to showpiece our beers, invite your friends and families, and for you all to have a great time.

The Salish Sea Brewing Company is the real deal!

We have three 10bbl fermenters in place, the 10bbl bright tank, kettle, and mash up and running!  Please join us for a beer soon.

data.name: Honey Hips Blonde
data.description: By far our most famous brew, Honey Hips’ stands alone. A pale golden color with a frothy, ample head, the aroma is floral honey and spicy citrus. Light and earthy flavors with a touch of malt sweetness in the front, it will leave you begging for the back. Her clean finish leaves Honey Hips extremely drinkable, but use caution, this blonde is strong enough to make your head swim.

If you’re up for it, we’d like to invite you to come along. Just meet us at Latitude 33.

breweries.name: The Lab Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Beer. Food. Music. It is based on these fundamental ingredients - the trifecta of entertainment - that The LAB Brewing Co. was born.  We take them all -- our beer, our food, and our music-- equally seriously. And we take great effort to combine them all to create a haven for all who share our appreciation for drinking, eating and being merry.

Beer lovers rejoice. With more than 25 handpicked microbrews on tap we have you covered. And that’s before adding our house brews, handcrafted by our brewmaster on site to the mix. From the aggressively hopped IPA Bad Influence to the oh-so-strong Take Her Home Belgian Tripel, our house brews not only pack a punch, but they are sure to awaken your taste buds. Beer aficionados and casual drinkers are encouraged to seek out our head brewer Roger for a tour of the premises or to talk shop.

Large stunning copper fermentation vessels align the restaurant and contribute to a unique dining experience. The setting is a perfect match for our eclectic American cuisine. Menu favorites include BBQ duck quesadilla, white lasagna and Alaskan cod in a hazelnut sage brown butter sauce. No, this isn’t your typical “bar food” – though the LAB Burger is to die for. Everything is fresh farm to table.

breweries.name: Tin Cannon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a small brewery that manufactures and sells beer in our tap room. We will be brewing on a 2 barrel (bbl) system when we open - 60 gallons per batch brewed.

Tin Cannon founders John Hilkert and Aaron Ludwig started out as a home brewers. John and Aaron met at church through their kids, who were (and still are) best friends. The kids would plan brew days at Aaron's house so they could play together, and John and Aaron could brew. John had started brewing on a beer kit and Aaron taught him the art of brewing all grain beers on his home made system. The planning of Tin Cannon came through many days of brewing with together in Aaron's dedicated brew room, or in John's garage. Aaron is an engineering guru and built a tremendous 10 gallon brewing system on his own, to include an electric master control panel. John likes to tinker and build stuff, and built stir plates, mash tuns, a kegerator and the like. When two innovative minds get together, they bring ingenuity, focus, style and creativity to each beer they brew. That's what you can expect to get when you come to Tin Cannon Brewing Co.

data.name: Hooker Blonde Ale
data.description:
Park City Brewery’s Hooker Blonde Ale is an excellent choice after a successful day on the river matching the hatch or stripping the perfect line…

It’s brewed in the classic Kolsch style from Cologne, Germany and is designed to be light and thirst quenching, similar to the pilsners familiar to many American beer drinkers.  It’s simply delicious, smooth, and tasty.

Clear with a bright, straw yellow hue, the Hooker Blonde Ale makes use of a single, noble hop variety throughout the boil for a zesty spice flavor and bitterness.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

While all affectionate flattery is graciously accepted, and most certainly appreciated, the management harbors certain reservations about being equated with most English pubs, the characteristics of which might not necessarily lend themselves to the western Maine mountain community.  Our prominent, esteemed, and highly experienced research team of Reynolds, Jones, Mulligan and Roy, have recently completed an extensive study of the supposed Anglo phenomenon, has concluded, and can unequivocally substantiate the following...

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

data.name: Hoppy Blonde
data.description: A light bodied ale with a little bit of hop punch.  ABV of 5.6% and an IBU of 36.  This very refreshing beer has some great mouth feel and a nice hop finish to make this an all around great ale.

data.name: Hoptober
data.description:
Five hops and four malts make Hoptober Golden Ale a veritable cornucopia of the earth.  Pale and wheat malt are mashed with rye and oats to create a medium-bodied ale with a creamy mouthfeel.

Centennial, Cascade, Sterling, Willamette, and Glacier hops form a bonfire of citrus notes, fruity cheers and a bold finale.

data.name: Hopton
data.description: Sunburst in color, Hopton's (Hp) rich aroma of thyme and fresh clover are testament to this element's earthly origins. Hopton (Hp) enters with complex notes of citrus, which escalates to a refreshing wave of grapefruit and kumquat. This beer's signature is marked by its hop finish–silky smooth and unshakably noble.

breweries.name: Mt. Carmel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mt. Carmel Brewing Company is a local family owned and operated brewery. The brewery was founded in May of 2005 by Cincinnati natives Mike and Kathleen Dewey. 

Inspired with a passion for good beer, founders Mike and Kathleen Dewey work towards providing exceptional craft beers to the greater Cincinnati area. We look forward to serving our customers, as if each was our first and only. We look to grow at a comfortable pace not to jeopardize our focus on product quality, customer service, and a respectful business practice.

We are proud to be a privately owned, genuinely independent free house in Bury and certainly the only brew pub in Suffolk where you can actually see beer in the making on a regular basis. Beers are made on the premises using East Anglian grown and ma

The Brewery does not specifically cater for young children and under 14s are not allowed in the bar at any time - however, at the manager's discretion, family groups are welcome to lunch together on Saturdays and Sundays.

Dogs are always welcome in the beer garden but only in the bar on a Sunday evening.

The Old Cannon, including the Brewery Rooms, is smoke-free. We have a designated smoking area with a heated umbrella in the beer garden.

breweries.name: Horny Goat Brewing Company
breweries.description: We’re often questioned about the origin of our name. Our story has it that “Spanish Fly Brewing” sounded too clumsy. Another says it was a bet at a card game. A third we’ve been advised by our lawyers not to discuss. While each rendition may have some truth to it, what it really boils down to is quite simple: Beer is fun. Brewing is fun. Drinking beer with your buddies is fun. So, why not a name that’s fun? After all, we’re in the business of helping people enjoy life. And we take our business very seriously. Our beers are craft-brewed for Old World taste and new world refreshment. Savored, slammed or sipped,these beers are also brewed to be sold and we plan on selling a lot of them. Aggressive marketing campaigns are in place to make sure Horny Goat Beers are on the radar of beer purchasers in select markets. Radio commercials, point-of-sale, guerilla tactics, swag, social media, you name it ‘cause we plan on growing, and growing large quickly. Kind of like a horny goat. So prepare yourself, the world is about to become a much hornier place.

breweries.name: COOP Ale Works
breweries.description:
COOP Ale Works began with a humble home brewer and a simple dream. The idea spread as friends tasted the unique beers, and the popularity of those early batches encouraged a dedicated team of three partners to begin working to make the dream of a local brewery a reality. Mark Seibold, JD Merryweather and Daniel Mercer spent the next two years traveling throughout the United States, Europe and Central America visiting breweries and sampling local flavors. The insight gained from entrepreneurs, brewers, biologists, operations personnel and consumers provided an invaluable basis for a serious endeavor into quality commercial brewing. By integrating this knowledge with the local, regional and national brewing trends, as well as local feedback, the trio planned the birth and growth of the yet unnamed COOP. After nearly 3 years of research, comprising thousands of man hours and dozens of test batches, COOP fashioned its identity as a steadfast professional team that holds closely a passion for bringing quality, local beer to taps and homes in Oklahoma City and beyond.

 

With the help of close friends and fellow craft-beer fans, COOP was capitalized on July 15th, 2008. In less than 6 months, the COOP team; navigated the multi-layered regulatory process, secured a building lease, completed the remodel, purchased and installed a commercial brewery, obtained brewing licenses from the State of Oklahoma and the Federal Tax and Trade Bureau, created and branded original recipe beers and brewed the first full scale batches for distribution.

The outpouring of support that has come from friends of the COOP team has been overwhelming. Our sincere hope is that you – the fan of COOP Ale Works – will take pride in the beers, as if they were your own. Thank you for your unwavering support and encouragement!

data.name: Horseneck Golden IPA
data.description: Super hoppy golden ale. Our Golden IPA's layers and layers of cascade hopping make this one heck of a crisp, bitter, big, golden brew that's perfect with BBQ and the flavors of summer.

breweries.name: Frankenmuth Brewery
breweries.description:
Frankenmuth’s founding fathers brought the traditions of brewing to the Mid-Michigan forests in 1845. John Matthias Falliers founded Frankenmuth’s first brewery in 1857. Cousins William Knaust and Martin Heubisch opened the Cass River Brewery just north of the Fallier property in 1862, where the Frankenmuth Brewery continues to stand today.

The Cass River Brewery was purchased by Johann Geyer in 1874, and renamed Geyer’s Brothers Brewing Co. For the next 112 years, the facility operated under many names including the Frankenmuth Brewing Co. Ferdinand “Fred” Schumacher from Duseldorf, Germany, purchased the brewery one year before a fire destroyed most of the structure in 1987.

The microbrewery continued operation following ownership acquisition by Randall E. Heine in 1990. The nation’s second oldest microbrewery was at peak production in 1996, distributing more than 30,000 barrels of locally produced microbrews across 25 states, when a F3 tornado struck our facility, causing several million dollars of damage. A brew pub was opened in 2003 and closed three years later.

Our Frankenmuth Brewing Company, housed in the historic four story, 28,000 square foot building is an exciting destination for food lovers and beer aficionados alike.

breweries.name: Central State Brewing
breweries.description:
Central State explores the delicate art of yeast interaction and cultivation in an experimental process as a third wave brewery dedicating themselves to 100% Brett brewing.

Founded by a technically-minded team with an experienced brewer, Central State aims to contribute to the innovation and knowledge-sharing culture that has defined this new generation of American brewing through experimentation, collaboration, and artisanal gypsy brewing.

Central State Brewing Co. is part of a renaissance of craft-minded producers helping revitalize small and mid-size cities across the midwest, sharing their inventiveness with small pockets of like-minded drinkers across the country who are looking for unique flavors and textures in their beer.

breweries.name: John A. Huber Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The John A Huber Brewing Company is a family owned and operated business. Here, brewing is family

"The concept for John A. Huber Brewing Company was set in motion in 1984 with the dreams of Missouri farmboy John Huber as he tasted his first home-brewed beer. In 2003, John received a home-brew kit for Christmas from his wife and sons. It was at that moment the Huber Brew or "Hubrew", the Company's flagship beer, was born. In 2009, he opened up Homebrew Supply of Southeast Missouri, LLC in Jackson, Missouri. In 2011, the John A. Huber Brewing Company took root in Fruitland, Missouri. The Company is a family owned and operated business. John's sons, Matthew and Chad, assist their father in the Company's operation. John and his family have lived in Southeast Missouri all their lives. They want to share their passion for brewing, their sense of community and their comradery. Come join them."

Hubrew is a packaging brewery. We do not currently have any onsite sales or tours.

breweries.name: Hawai'i Nui Brewing
breweries.description:
At Hawai‘i Nui Brewing, we’re passionate about craft beer. We brew small batches of our all-natural ales and lagers from the finest barley malt, wheat, hops and yeast.  We are committed to local production in Hawai‘i.  

Our uniquely well balanced Island Style beer is perfect for your time in Paradise!

What is Island Style? To those of us who call Hawai’i home, it’s all about balance. Working hard, sure. But when pau hana time comes, it’s about friends and family. Heeding the call of the sun and sand, surf and sea. Tasting freshness. Celebrating music. Stopping at sunset. Resting easy at night. Appreciating life’s detours–what we call holo holo time. Living life as it should be.

data.name: Ice Nine
data.description:
Brewed specifically for the Whiteaker Block Party, Ice Nine is a light and flavorful golden ale. Made with Northwest Pale Ale and Honey malts, this beer finishes crisply. And like its inspiration -- a fictional super-cooling polymorph dreamed up by Kurt Vonnegut -- it is sure to add a little ice to a hot summer day. Ice Nine -- serve cold and morph with it!

Draft Only

breweries.name: Ninkasi Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

breweries.name: Angry Chair Brewing
breweries.description:
The ultimate plan at Angry Chair Brewing is to brew beers that we like to drink. Right now we like to drink more sessionable styles: hoppy pale ales, Berliner weisses, low ABV saison, and other easy-drinkers. We plan to lean on these styles for our core beers. However, one thing we absolutely believe to be true is that the public will be choosing our “core” beers for us: if you like the beer, we will keep brewing it.
We’re going to have an extensive barrel-aged program as well, especially for sour beers.

We definitely hate being boring and doing boring stuff so you can look forward to experimentation and unique projects.

breweries.name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
breweries.description:
We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.

All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.

We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

data.name: Iron Spike - Blonde
data.description:
Iron Spike Blonde introduces itself with an antique gold colour accentuated with a generous white foam.  Nose of honey, spicy, lemon zest and citric hops, some biscuit malt, a nice peach/tropical fruit profile as well.

On the pallet the beer enters with a hint of sweet fruit upfront (peach, pear mostly), followed by lemon, some mild hops, and sweet grains. It has a floral aftertaste, similar to that of rose petals.  Lots of pretty spider web lace left behind from the head, and good retention.

Medium body with a sweet fruit finish, nicely balanced by moderate thoughtful hopping."

data.name: Isabella Blonde
data.description:
The Kern River flows into Lake Isabella less then one mile south of Kernville, Ca. 

 This Blonde Ale has an easy malt body and a mild hop aroma produced by traditional English hops. The light straw color and crisp finish make this an easy drinking beer that's great for those hot summer days. If you are looking for great taste and good times, don't settle for just any blonde, choose Isabella Blonde!

breweries.name: Kern River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Kern River Brewing Company (KRBC) brings people back to the magnificent simplicities that life has to offer.

From its beginnings, Kernville has been a wild-west town.  Established as a mining settlement in the mid 1800's and continuing as a ranching community through the 1900's, Kernville remains a town of adventure, offering a wide variety of outdoor activities.  On any given day, the outdoor enthusiast enjoys activities ranging from the excitement of whitewater rafting, kayaking, downhill skiing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling, horseback riding, attending rodeos, windsurfing, water-skiing, mountain biking and climbing.  If a more relaxing day is preferred, people can enjoy fishing, hiking, camping, sailing, antiquing, and bird watching or simply kicking back and taking in the spectacular views of the Sierra Nevada mountain range.

data.name: Island Mesa Blonde Ale
data.description:
A crisp English Summer Ale with a light hop accent to peak your interest. Brewed for the summers in the high desert of Colorado where it's hot in the day and cool in the night.  Pairs well with a float down the river or an evening by the campfire. 

Available on draft year-round or in bottles throughout the summer months.

breweries.name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
West of the Rockies there is an ancient volcano known as the Grand Mesa, the largest geographic feature in the world of its kind. From this mountain runs a creek called Kannah that flows into the high desert of the Grand Valley of Colorado and offers some of the purest water in the United States.  At the foot of the Mesa, we stand, Kannah Creek Brewing Company, where we turn this pure, untouched snowmelt into award winning classic American craft ale.

Since 2005 Kannah Creek has been turning the finest ingredients and a privileged water source into amazing craft ale with a focus on quality and tradition.  With several awards to our name and a town full of friends we found demand soaring, and our 7 barrel system couldn't keep up. We have expanded into a 12,000 sq. ft., state of the art 30 barrel production facility, Edgewater, in South Downtown, Grand Junction, Colorado.

breweries.name: Great Crescent Brewery
breweries.description:
The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.
We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.

We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

breweries.name: Nelson Brewery
breweries.description:
The brewery was first brought to the Historic Dockyard at Chatham as the Flagship Brewery in 1995 where it established a five barrel kit brewing up to 100 firkins a week. All the ales have nautical themed names to gel with the surroundings in which it is brewed


In 2003 the brewery was bought and renamed the Nelson Brewing Company to fall in line with the most famous naval hero of all time 'Admiral Horatio Nelson' and that his flagship 'The Victory' was built here in Chatham Dockyard.

In July 2006 the brewery was purchased by Piers Macdonald. Piers has over 20 years experience in the brewing industry and is passionate to keep the traditions of Kent brewing alive. Using the best ingredients and the finest Kent hops, combined with the expertise and dedication of his brewing staff, Piers plans to build on the brewery's already growing reputation as the provider of some of the tastiest ales on the market.

Now brewing from a seven and a half barrel kit and regularly having over a dozen ales of various strengths and taste available, the brewery is sure to have a beer to suit all!

breweries.description: The ancient legend of the Green Man influenced our brewery's inception in 1997. As one of Asheville's oldest breweries, we are proud to craft some of the beer scene's most iconic ales. Loyalty to traditional brewing techniques while creating innovative ales is Green Man's constant quest.
